questionText: Which programming paradigm focuses on objects and their interactions?
reason: Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) organizes code using objects and classes.

questionText: Which version control system is widely used in software development?
reason: Git is a distributed version control system commonly used in development.

questionText: Which language is primarily used for web frontend development?
reason: JavaScript is the main language for web frontend interaction.

questionText: Which software development methodology emphasizes iterative development?
reason: Agile promotes iterative and incremental development cycles.

questionText: Which data structure uses LIFO (Last In, First Out) principle?
reason: A stack follows Last In, First Out (LIFO) ordering.

questionText: Which data structure uses FIFO (First In, First Out) principle?
reason: A queue follows First In, First Out (FIFO) ordering.

questionText: Which software testing type verifies individual units or functions?
reason: Unit testing checks individual units or components for correctness.

questionText: Which term describes fixing errors in software code?
reason: Debugging is the process of finding and fixing code errors.

questionText: Which software design principle encourages code reusability?
reason: DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself) promotes reusing code instead of duplicating it.

questionText: Which software development environment allows writing and testing code?
reason: An Integrated Development Environment (IDE) is used to write, debug, and test code.

questionText: Which programming paradigm focuses on pure functions and immutability?
reason: Functional programming emphasizes pure functions and avoids changing state.

questionText: Which keyword in C# defines a constant value?
reason: 'const' declares a compile-time constant.

questionText: Which software document describes system requirements?
reason: SRS (software Requirements Specification) outlines the system requirements.

questionText: Which design principle suggests components should be open for extension but closed for modification?
reason: Open/Closed Principle promotes extending functionality without changing existing code.

questionText: Which software tool is used to manage project tasks and track progress?
reason: Jira is commonly used for task management in software projects.

questionText: Which programming concept allows code reuse through inheritance?
reason: Inheritance allows a class to inherit properties and methods from another class.

questionText: Which term describes the process of improving code structure without changing its behavior?
reason: Refactoring improves code readability and maintainability without affecting functionality.

questionText: Which programming concept hides internal details of a class?
reason: Encapsulation hides the internal state and requires access through methods.

questionText: Which programming concept allows using objects of different types through the same interface?
reason: Polymorphism allows objects of different classes to be treated as the same type through a common interface.

questionText: Which programming principle suggests keeping things simple and avoiding unnecessary complexity?
reason: KISS (Keep It Simple, Stupid) emphasizes simplicity in design and implementation.

questionText: Which programming principle suggests not repeating code unnecessarily?
reason: DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself) encourages reusing code instead of duplication.

questionText: Which term describes developing software in small, incremental pieces?
reason: Iterative development builds software in small, testable increments.

questionText: Which type of loop executes code as long as a condition is true?
reason: A while loop repeats code while the condition is true.

questionText: Which type of loop executes code at least once before checking the condition?
reason: A do-while loop runs once before evaluating the condition.

questionText: Which software development activity ensures software meets quality standards?
reason: Testing verifies that software works correctly and meets requirements.

questionText: Which type of testing checks integration of multiple components?
reason: Integration testing ensures components work together correctly.

questionText: Which type of testing validates the software against user requirements?
reason: Acceptance testing ensures the software meets user needs.

questionText: Which software document defines how to deploy an application?
reason: A deployment guide outlines steps to install and deploy software.

questionText: Which type of software maintenance fixes bugs after release?
reason: Corrective maintenance fixes defects discovered after release.

questionText: Which type of software maintenance improves performance or features?
reason: Perfective maintenance enhances software functionality or performance.

questionText: Which type of software maintenance adapts software to changes in environment?
reason: Adaptive maintenance modifies software to work in new environments.

questionText: Which type of software maintenance prevents future defects?
reason: Preventive maintenance anticipates potential problems and prevents them.

questionText: Which term refers to writing instructions for a computer to perform tasks?
reason: Programming is writing code that tells a computer what to do.

questionText: Which tool automates software builds and deployment?
reason: CI/CD pipelines automate building, testing, and deploying software.

questionText: Which practice involves reviewing code to detect errors before merging?
reason: Code review improves quality by having peers examine code before integration.

questionText: Which software architecture pattern separates concerns into Model, View, and Controller?
reason: MVC (Model-View-Controller) separates application logic, UI, and input handling.

questionText: Which type of variable can store multiple values of the same type?
reason: An array holds multiple values of the same type in contiguous memory.

questionText: Which data structure stores key-value pairs?
reason: Dictionaries or maps store values associated with unique keys.

questionText: Which type of loop is best when the number of iterations is known?
reason: For loops are ideal for a known number of iterations.

questionText: Which software principle encourages separating unrelated functions into different modules?
reason: Separation of Concerns improves maintainability by dividing responsibilities.

questionText: Which programming keyword defines a class in C#?
reason: 'class' defines a class in C# and other OOP languages.

questionText: Which statement exits a loop immediately in most programming languages?
reason: 'break' exits the current loop immediately.

questionText: Which statement skips the current iteration of a loop?
reason: 'continue' skips the current loop iteration and moves to the next.

questionText: Which testing type ensures the system works as a whole?
reason: System testing validates the entire integrated system for correctness.

questionText: Which type of testing checks the software against user requirements?
reason: Acceptance testing ensures the software meets user needs and requirements.

questionText: Which term describes creating a temporary copy of data to speed up access?
reason: Caching stores data temporarily to improve performance.

questionText: Which type of error occurs when code compiles but fails during execution?
reason: Runtime errors occur while the program is running.

questionText: Which type of error occurs when code violates syntax rules?
reason: Syntax errors violate language grammar and prevent compilation.

questionText: Which type of error occurs when code produces incorrect results despite running?
reason: Logic errors occur when code behaves incorrectly but runs without crashing.

questionText: Which keyword in C# defines a function that does not return a value?
reason: 'void' indicates that a method does not return any value.

questionText: Which programming concept allows functions to call themselves?
reason: Recursion occurs when a function calls itself directly or indirectly.

questionText: Which software model follows strict sequential phases?
reason: Waterfall model follows sequential steps like requirements, design, implementation, testing.

questionText: Which term describes automatically running tests on each code change?
reason: Continuous testing is part of CI/CD to ensure quality on each code change.

questionText: Which type of software metric measures code complexity?
reason: Cyclomatic complexity quantifies the number of independent paths in code.

questionText: Which design pattern ensures a class has only one instance?
reason: Singleton pattern restricts a class to a single instance.

questionText: Which design pattern separates the construction of a complex object from its representation?
reason: Builder pattern constructs complex objects step by step.

questionText: Which design pattern provides an interface to create families of related objects?
reason: Abstract Factory provides a way to create related objects without specifying concrete classes.

questionText: Which type of diagram shows classes and relationships in OOP?
reason: Class diagrams visualize classes, attributes, methods, and their relationships.

questionText: Which version control term describes copying a repository to local machine?
reason: Cloning creates a local copy of the remote repository.

questionText: Which version control term sends local changes to remote repository?
reason: Push uploads local commits to the remote repository.

questionText: Which term describes recording changes to the version control system?
reason: Commit saves local changes in version control history.

questionText: Which term in Git integrates changes from one branch into another?
reason: Merge combines changes from different branches into a single branch.

questionText: Which C# keyword prevents modification of a variable after initialization?
reason: 'readonly' allows assignment only at declaration or in constructor.

questionText: Which loop is ideal for iterating over elements of a collection in C#?
reason: 'foreach' iterates over collections easily without indexing.

questionText: Which term describes a reusable piece of code that performs a specific task?
reason: Functions/methods encapsulate code to perform tasks and can be reused.

questionText: Which programming practice divides a program into small, testable units?
reason: Modular programming improves maintainability and testability by dividing code into modules.

questionText: Which C# access modifier makes members accessible only within the same class?
reason: 'private' restricts access to the defining class only.

questionText: Which C# access modifier allows access from derived classes?
reason: 'protected' allows access within the class and its derived classes.

questionText: Which C# keyword allows creating an instance of a class?
reason: 'new' is used to instantiate an object in C#.

questionText: Which term describes the process of converting requirements into a software design?
reason: software design transforms requirements into a blueprint for implementation.

questionText: Which programming construct allows decision making based on conditions?
reason: if/else statements execute different code blocks based on conditions.

questionText: Which C# keyword allows handling exceptions?
reason: try/catch is used to catch and handle runtime exceptions.

questionText: Which term describes repeating a process until a condition is met?
reason: Iteration repeats code execution while a condition holds true.

questionText: Which software metric measures code coverage by automated tests?
reason: Test coverage shows the percentopice of code executed by tests.

questionText: Which type of relationship represents a 'has-a' association in OOP?
reason: Composition/Aggregation shows one class contains or is made up of another.

questionText: Which keyword defines an interface in C#?
reason: 'interface' defines a contract of methods and properties without implementation.

questionText: Which type of loop is guaranteed to execute at least once?
reason: do-while evaluates the condition after executing the loop body once.

questionText: Which term describes storing temporary data to reduce repeated calculations?
reason: Caching saves intermediate results for faster access later.

questionText: Which principle suggests modules should have only one reason to change?
reason: Each module or class should have only one responsibility.

questionText: Which practice integrates code changes frequently and runs automated tests?
reason: CI merges code frequently and ensures automated tests pass on each change.

questionText: Which type of loop is preferred when iterating a known number of times?
reason: for loops are best for a fixed number of iterations.

questionText: Which type of testing ensures modified code does not break existing features?
reason: Regression testing checks that new changes don't introduce bugs in existing functionality.

questionText: Which design pattern defines a family of algorithms and makes them interchangeable?
reason: Strategy pattern allows changing the algorithm dynamically at runtime.

questionText: Which term describes the process of preparing code for deployment?
reason: Building compiles and packages code for deployment.

questionText: Which term describes software written to be portable across platforms?
reason: Cross-platform software runs on multiple operating systems without modification.

questionText: Which concept allows different methods to have the same name but different parameters?
reason: Method overloading allows multiple methods with the same name but different parameter lists.

questionText: Which concept allows a derived class to provide a specific implementation of a method in the base class?
reason: Method overriding allows a subclass to replace or extend base class functionality.

questionText: Which type of software testing checks individual lines or branches of code?
reason: White-box testing inspects the internal code logic to verify correctness.

questionText: Which type of software testing focuses on functionality without looking at internal code?
reason: Black-box testing validates software behavior from user perspective.

questionText: Which term describes converting human-readable code to machine-readable instructions?
reason: Compilation transforms source code into executable machine code.

questionText: Which programming concept allows defining variables outside functions for global access?
reason: Global variables are accessible from any part of the program.

questionText: Which software deployment type updates code directly on production servers?
reason: Continuous Deployment automatically deploys code changes to production after passing tests.

questionText: Which programming term refers to creating a new object based on an existing object?
reason: Instantiation creates a new instance of a class or object.

questionText: Which C# keyword ensures a method can be overridden by a derived class?
reason: 'virtual' allows derived classes to override a method.

questionText: Which C# keyword overrides a virtual method in a derived class?
reason: 'override' provides a new implementation of a virtual method.

questionText: Which term describes a tool that tracks changes, branches, and merges code?
reason: VCS helps manage code changes and collaboration.

questionText: Which software engineering model uses prototypes to gather user feedback early?
reason: Prototyping builds preliminary versions to collect user feedback.

questionText: Which term describes the practice of monitoring and maintaining software performance after release?
reason: software maintenance ensures applications continue to operate efficiently after release.

questionText: Which concept refers to hiding implementation details and exposing only necessary functionality?
reason: Abstraction simplifies complexity by showing only essential features.

questionText: Which software development activity involves improving code readability and structure without changing behavior?
reason: Refactoring improves code quality while keeping functionality intact.
